AbstractText: A mild and efficient enantioselective amination of 4-alkylisoquinoline-1,3(2H,4H)-dione derivatives was established, which is compatible with a broad range of substrates and delivers the final products in excellent yields (up to 99%) and ee values (up to 99%) with low catalyst loading (down to 1 mol%). The synthetic potential of this methodology was also demonstrated in the gram scale level.
